title: Jude Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Jude with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 1 chapters.

questions.question: Who is the author of the book of Jude?
questions.explanation: Jude identifies himself as the author in Jude 1:1, calling himself a servant of Jesus Christ and brother of James.

questions.question: To whom is the epistle of Jude addressed?
options: Them that are sanctified by God the Father
questions.correctAnswer: Them that are sanctified by God the Father
questions.explanation: Jude addresses the letter to those who are sanctified by God the Father and preserved in Jesus Christ.

questions.question: What three blessings does Jude wish to be multiplied to the recipients?
questions.explanation: Jude wishes mercy, peace, and love to be multiplied to the readers.

questions.question: What urgent exhortation does Jude give concerning the faith?
options: To earnestly contend for the faith once delivered to the saints
questions.correctAnswer: To earnestly contend for the faith once delivered to the saints
questions.explanation: Jude urges believers to earnestly contend for the faith which was once delivered to the saints.

questions.question: What kind of men had crept in unawares into the church, according to Jude?
options: Ungodly men turning the grace of God into lasciviousness
questions.correctAnswer: Ungodly men turning the grace of God into lasciviousness
questions.explanation: Jude warns of ungodly men turning the grace of God into lasciviousness and denying the Lord Jesus Christ.

questions.question: What Old Testament event does Jude remind his readers about as an example of judgment?
options: The destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah
questions.correctAnswer: The destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah
questions.explanation: Jude refers to Sodom and Gomorrah and the cities about them as an example of eternal fire judgment.

questions.question: What does Jude say about the angels who did not keep their first estate?
options: They were cast into the sea
They are reserved in everlasting chains under darkness unto judgment
They were made rulers of the earth
questions.correctAnswer: They are reserved in everlasting chains under darkness unto judgment
questions.explanation: Jude states that angels who left their first estate are reserved in everlasting chains under darkness for judgment.

questions.question: Who contended with the devil over the body of Moses, according to Jude?
questions.explanation: Michael the archangel disputed with the devil about the body of Moses but did not bring a railing accusation.

questions.question: What three Old Testament figures' ways does Jude say the ungodly follow?
questions.explanation: Jude says the ungodly have gone in the way of Cain, the error of Balaam for reward, and the gainsaying of Core.

questions.question: How does Jude describe the ungodly in relation to their appearance at feasts of charity?
questions.explanation: Jude describes them as spots in feasts of charity, clouds without water, trees without fruit, twice dead, plucked up by the roots.

questions.question: What imagery does Jude use to describe the ungodly in verse 13?
options: Raging waves of the sea and wandering stars
questions.correctAnswer: Raging waves of the sea and wandering stars
questions.explanation: Jude describes them as raging waves foaming out their own shame and wandering stars reserved for darkness forever.

questions.question: Who is the seventh from Adam who prophesied about the coming judgment?
questions.explanation: Enoch, the seventh from Adam, prophesied about the Lord coming with ten thousands of his saints to execute judgment.

questions.question: What does Jude say about the speech of the ungodly in verse 15?
options: They speak great swelling words and hard speeches against God
questions.correctAnswer: They speak great swelling words and hard speeches against God
questions.explanation: Jude states that ungodly sinners speak hard speeches against the Lord and commit ungodly deeds.

questions.question: How does Jude characterize the ungodly in verse 16?
options: Murmurers and complainers walking after their own lusts
questions.correctAnswer: Murmurers and complainers walking after their own lusts
questions.explanation: Jude describes them as murmurers, complainers, walking after their own lusts with great swelling words.

questions.question: According to Jude, who told the believers there would be mockers in the last time?
options: The apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: The apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Jude reminds the readers of the apostles' words that mockers would come in the last time.

questions.question: How does Jude describe those who separate themselves from the believers?
options: Spiritual and filled with the Spirit
Sensual and having not the Spirit
questions.correctAnswer: Sensual and having not the Spirit
questions.explanation: Jude says those who separate themselves are sensual and do not have the Spirit.

questions.question: What two actions does Jude encourage the believers to do in verses 20 and 21?
options: Build up yourselves on your most holy faith and pray in the Holy Ghost
Preach the gospel and fast often
Sing psalms and keep the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: Build up yourselves on your most holy faith and pray in the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: Believers are urged to build themselves up on their most holy faith and pray in the Holy Ghost.

questions.question: What should believers keep themselves in, according to Jude 1:21?
questions.explanation: Jude instructs believers to keep themselves in the love of God while looking for the mercy of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: What does Jude say about how to treat some who are doubting or erring?
options: Have compassion and make a difference
questions.correctAnswer: Have compassion and make a difference
questions.explanation: Jude encourages showing compassion and making a difference to some, saving others with fear.

questions.question: What metaphor does Jude use for those saved with fear?
options: Pulling them out of the fire
questions.correctAnswer: Pulling them out of the fire
questions.explanation: Jude states to save some with fear, pulling them out of the fire, hating even the garment spotted by the flesh.

questions.question: To whom does Jude give glory and majesty at the end of the epistle?
options: The only wise God our Saviour
questions.correctAnswer: The only wise God our Saviour
questions.explanation: Jude ends with a doxology to the only wise God our Saviour, giving Him glory and majesty.

questions.question: True or False: Jude says that the ungodly deny the only Lord God and our Lord Jesus Christ.
questions.explanation: Jude states that certain men deny the only Lord God and our Lord Jesus Christ, turning grace into lasciviousness.

questions.question: True or False: Jude encourages believers to separate themselves from the ungodly mockers.
questions.explanation: Jude notes that those who separate themselves are sensual and lack the Spirit, implying believers should avoid them.

questions.question: True or False: Michael the archangel rebuked the devil with railing accusations over Moses' body.
questions.explanation: Michael did not bring a railing accusation but said, 'The Lord rebuke thee.'

questions.question: True or False: Jude warns that the ungodly are like trees whose fruit withereth and are twice dead.
questions.explanation: Jude describes ungodly men as trees without fruit, twice dead, plucked up by the roots.

questions.question: True or False: Jude says that the Lord will come with ten thousands of his saints to execute judgment.
questions.explanation: Jude quotes Enoch's prophecy about the Lord coming with many saints to judge the ungodly.

questions.question: True or False: Jude instructs believers to build themselves up on their most holy faith.
questions.explanation: Jude encourages building up in the most holy faith and praying in the Holy Ghost.

questions.question: True or False: Jude says that the ungodly are like clouds full of water that nourish the earth.
questions.explanation: Jude says they are clouds without water, carried about by winds.

questions.question: True or False: Jude mentions that the Lord destroyed the people who believed not after saving them out of Egypt.
questions.explanation: Jude reminds readers that God destroyed unbelieving Israelites after delivering them from Egypt.

questions.question: True or False: Jude says that the ungodly speak evil of things they understand perfectly.
questions.explanation: Jude says they speak evil of things they know not, corrupting themselves as brute beasts.

questions.question: True or False: Jude identifies the ungodly as murmurers and complainers walking after their own lusts.
questions.explanation: Jude describes the ungodly as murmurers and complainers walking after their own lusts.

questions.question: True or False: Jude says that the ungodly are wandering stars reserved for the blackness of darkness forever.
questions.explanation: Jude uses the metaphor of wandering stars reserved for darkness to describe the ungodly.

questions.question: True or False: Jude commands believers to hate the garment spotted by the flesh but show no compassion for sinners.
questions.explanation: Jude instructs to hate the spotted garment but to have compassion for some and save others with fear.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Keep yourselves in the love of ____, looking for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ.'
questions.explanation: The verse exhorts believers to keep themselves in the love of God.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Woe unto them! for they have gone in the way of Cain, and ran greedily after the error of ____ for reward.'
questions.explanation: Jude names Balaam as an example of greed and error followed by the ungodly.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'These are ____ in your feasts of charity, when they feast with you, feeding themselves without fear.'
questions.explanation: Jude calls the ungodly spots in feasts of charity.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Now unto him that is able to keep you from falling, and to present you ____ before the presence of his glory.'
questions.explanation: Jude speaks of presenting believers faultless before God's glory.

questions.question: What is the main theme of the book of Jude?
options: Contending for the faith against ungodly intruders
questions.correctAnswer: Contending for the faith against ungodly intruders
questions.explanation: Jude's primary focus is warning against false teachers and urging believers to defend the faith.

questions.question: What phrase does Jude use to describe the faith that was delivered to the saints?
questions.explanation: Jude refers to the faith as 'once delivered unto the saints.'

questions.question: Which example of divine judgment involving unbelief does Jude mention from Israel's history?
options: The destruction of those who believed not after Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: The destruction of those who believed not after Egypt
questions.explanation: Jude reminds that God destroyed those who did not believe after being saved from Egypt.

questions.question: What do the 'filthy dreamers' do, according to Jude 1:8?
options: Defile the flesh, despise dominion, and speak evil of dignities
questions.correctAnswer: Defile the flesh, despise dominion, and speak evil of dignities
questions.explanation: Jude describes them as defiling the flesh and speaking evil of dignities.

questions.question: What is reserved for the ungodly according to Jude 1:13?
questions.explanation: Jude says the ungodly are reserved for the blackness of darkness forever.

questions.question: How does Jude describe those who speak evil of things they do not know?
questions.explanation: Jude compares such people to brute beasts who corrupt themselves.

questions.question: What is the nature of the judgment to come, according to Enoch's prophecy quoted by Jude?
options: Judgment on all and convincing ungodly of their deeds and words
The establishment of a new kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: Judgment on all and convincing ungodly of their deeds and words
questions.explanation: Enoch prophesied the Lord would judge all, convincing ungodly of their deeds and hard speeches.

questions.question: Which of these does Jude NOT mention as a characteristic of the ungodly?
questions.explanation: Jude describes the ungodly with negative traits, not as lovers of God.
